entry.title: Taking Back the Em Dash
entry.summary: There was a time when the em dash was a powerful tool in the writer‚Äôs arsenal‚Äîused to interrupt, to emphasize, to inject tone or rhythm into a sentence. I‚Äôve used it for years, even had to Google it more times than I care to admit just to copy and paste the damn thing. And then AI came along. Now, you can barely read an article without seeing em dashes everywhere. It‚Äôs become something of a tell. If you see a piece overloaded with them, chances are someone‚Äôs whispering, ‚ÄúThis was written by a GPT.‚Äù Now, don't get me wrong. I use AI. I like AI. This very post even had some AI input. But let‚Äôs be clear: my voice is my own. I‚Äôm not giving up my favorite punctuation mark because the bots happen to like it a little too much. I‚Äôm taking back the em dash. Not because it‚Äôs trendy or controversial. Because it‚Äôs useful. Because sometimes a comma is too weak, and a period is too final. Because sometimes, an em dash says exactly what I want to say with just the right pause. So if you see one in my writing, don‚Äôt assume anything‚Äîexcept that I meant to use it.

Just like software delivery transformed 20 years ago, infrastructure is now being reshaped by: Infrastructure-as-Code Automation layers Policy-as-code and governance controls The goal? Make infrastructure delivery as fast and reliable as software. But most teams are stuck in limbo ‚Äî patchy IaC adoption, inconsi‚Ä¶

entry.title: How to Use the Terraform AWS Provider: A Practical Guide
entry.summary:
Terraform is one of the most popular tools for managing cloud infrastructure as code (IaC), and AWS is the most widely used cloud platform. The Terraform AWS Provider is what connects these two powerhouses. In this short guide, we‚Äôll cover: What the Terraform AWS Provider does
How to set it up
Basic examples of infrastructure provisioning
Key best practices to avoid pitfalls
If you're looking for a deeper walkthrough, check out our complete Terraform AWS Provider Guide. A Terraform provider is a plugin that lets Terraform communicate with external APIs ‚Äî like those offered by AWS, Azure, GCP, and many more. Providers come in three types: Official ‚Äî Maintained by HashiCorp (e.g., AWS, Azure)
Partner ‚Äî Built by tech vendors who integrate via HashiCorp‚Äôs framework
Community ‚Äî Open source contributions for niche or emerging platforms The AWS provider falls in the official category and is arguably the most widely used. Here‚Äôs a basic 4-step process to start using Terraform with AWS: Install Terraform CLI from terraform.io
Install and configure the AWS CLI:
aws configure
Create a file named main.tf and paste the following block: provider "aws" { region = "us-east-1" }
resource "aws_vpc" "demo_vpc" { cidr_block = "10.0.0.0/16"
tags = { Name = "demo_vpc" } }
Run the following commands: terraform init terraform plan terraform apply
‚úÖ This will provision your VPC in AWS via the Terraform AWS Provider. Having trouble with these steps? Here‚Äôs a detailed guide on how to troubleshoot and debug Terraform on AWS. üîê Bonus: Security Best Practices
‚úÖ Don‚Äôt hardcode credentials ‚Äî use environment variables or shared profiles
‚úÖ Encrypt your Terraform state when stored in S3
‚úÖ Use sensitive variables to prevent secrets from being exposed in outputs
Example:
variable "aws_access_key" { type = string sensitive = true }
üìñ Want to go deeper? Terraform AWS Provider Guide (full version)
How to Troubleshoot & Debug Terraform on AWS

entry.title: You Are Not Your Job: Reclaiming Your Identity as a Software Engineer
entry.summary: Who are you? If your first instinct is to say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a software engineer‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a developer,‚Äù I invite you to pause for a moment and dig a little deeper. That‚Äôs exactly where I found myself after graduating from university and landing my first job. For years, my goal was clear: get a degree, start a career. It felt like the default path ‚Äî everyone around me was on it, and society cheered it on. But when I stepped into the working world as a software engineer, I felt unexpectedly lost. Without the structure of school or passions outside of work, I poured everything into my job. The long hours debugging code, learning new frameworks, and chasing deadlines became my identity. Climbing the career ladder seemed like the natural next step ‚Äî after all, it‚Äôs what my parents did, and it‚Äôs what the‚Ä¶

entry.title: XLS-0075d: Permission Delegation Performance Test Report
entry.summary:
Introduction
Permission Delegation is a proposed amendment to the XRPL that enables accounts to selectively delegate transaction permissions to other accounts. This mechanism enhances account usability by allowing account holders to distribute specific responsibilities‚Äîsuch as issuing tokens or authorizing trustlines‚Äîwithout relinquishing full control over their accounts. By supporting fine-grained authorization, Permission Delegation unlocks new possibilities for multi-party workflows, external integrations, and advanced account management strategies, while maintaining a strong security posture. To evaluate the performance implications of this feature, the RippleX performance team carried out targeted benchmarking to assess the impact of delegated transactions on ledger throughput, vali‚Ä¶

entry.title: Native Hongmeng Router-Navigation Summary
entry.summary: Navigation route navigation The concept is: the entire application has only one page, and the rest are components [Huawei recommends using Navigation route navigation] The first routing method import { Friend } from './Friend' @builder Subcomponents need to export the global builder separately WrapBuilder wrapBuilder is a global function It will return a type of WrapBuilder<[]>, the empty array is the type of the parameter map.get(name).builder() @builder @builder { "routerMap": [ .onWillAppear(() => { pushPath (append)/replacePath (replace), unlimited layers Some common properties of the Navigation component Recommendations for NavDestination Components It is not recommended to set layout-related properties such as position and size, as this may cause abnormal page display.

Sick of Ad-Infested Dev Tools? Here‚Äôs a Clean, Fast Alternative
entry.summary:
Ever found yourself Googling for a simple dev tool ‚Äî only to land on a page that barely does anything and is 90% ads?
Yeah, same here. So I built my own no-BS site with the most commonly used dev tools. Clean UI, no ads, just tools that work. üëâ Check it out: https://onlinewebdevtools.com Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find there: JSON Formatter ‚Äî Format and beautify JSON with customizable options
JSON to XML ‚Äî Convert JSON to XML format
JSON to ENV ‚Äî Convert JSON to environment variables format
JSON Query Explorer ‚Äî Query and explore complex JSON structures
‚úèÔ∏è TEXT TOOLS
Text Diff Checker ‚Äî Compare and diff text files side by side
Word Counter ‚Äî Count words, characters and analyze text statistics
Lorem Ipsum Generator ‚Äî Generate placeholder text in paragraphs, sentences or words
Markdown Preview ‚Äî Preview Markdown with real-time HTML rendering
üìä CSV TOOLS
CSV Viewer ‚Äî View and explore CSV files in tabular format
üîó URL TOOLS
URL Encoder ‚Äî Encode and decode URLs
URL to QR Code ‚Äî Generate QR codes from URLs
üì¶ BASE64 TOOLS
Base64 Encoder/Decoder ‚Äî Encode and decode Base64 strings
Base64 to File ‚Äî Convert Base64 strings to downloadable files
Base64 to HEX ‚Äî Convert between Base64 and hexadecimal formats
üî¢ HEX TOOLS
HEX Encoder/Decoder ‚Äî Encode and decode text using hexadecimal format
HEX to File ‚Äî Convert hexadecimal data to downloadable files
HEX to Base64 ‚Äî Convert hexadecimal data to Base64 encoding
‚öõÔ∏è REACT TOOLS
SVG to React Component ‚Äî Convert SVG files to React components
üß∞ MISC TOOLS
Color Converter ‚Äî Convert between color formats (HEX, RGB, HSL)
JWT Decode ‚Äî Decode and verify JWT tokens
SQL Formatter ‚Äî Format and beautify SQL queries with syntax highlighting
Let me know what tool you'd like me to add next!
I built this for devs, so suggestions and feedback are welcome üôå ‚û°Ô∏è Visit: https://onlinewebdevtools.com

entry.title: TryHackMe: HTTP in Detail
entry.summary: Hey hackersüëã this is the write-up for the HTTP in Detail room on TryHackMe https://tryhackme.com/room/httpindetail The room provides a beginner-friendly walkthrough of how the HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) works, including its secure version, HTTPS. It covers essential concepts like HTTP methods (GET, POST, etc.), status codes, headers, cookies, and how requests and responses are structured. The room includes hands-on exercises to help users understand web communication and how data is transmitted between clients and servers, making it a solid foundation for anyone starting in web security or networking. What does HTTP stand for? HyperText Transfer Protocol What does the S in HTTPS stand for? secure On the mock webpage on the right there is an issue, once you've found it, click on it‚Ä¶
